title.rendered: Leading the World in Education Technology

content.rendered:
To Matt Hancock MP, Minister for Skills and Enterprise

Education Industrial Strategy: Leading the World in Education Technology

MirandaNet Fellowship contribution from the MirandaNet Associates and Professors Christina Preston, Marilyn Leask and Dr Sarah Younie, MirandaNet Fellowship, University of Bedfordshire.

MirandaNet agenda item for meeting on the 9th May at the request of Matt Hancock,MP, who was appointed Minister of State for Skills and Enterprise in October 2013. He is the Conservative MP for West Suffolk.

You will find our paper here: Education Industrial Strategy: Leading the World in Education Technology.

Thanks to Brother and LightSpeed for the technical support in recording the meeting on 28th April at UKIE where ideas for this paper were developed.

Thanks to the EU HandsOn ICT  project for hosting the event.
